October 11, 1962
Mr. Harold Hill
Vice-President
NAEB
131*6 Connecticut Ave.
Washington 6, D. C.
Dear Harold:
It has taken me all this time to get over the NYSERTA Meeting, and find a few
moments to thank you for the major contribution -which you made to it. Just
your being there was enough as far as I*m concerned. But, the comments and
suggestions that you made, both privately and during the meetings themselves,
were a tremendous asset5 all the more so because having you there provided the
kind of recognition of NYSERTA that we could not get any other way.
It was great fun having you over to visit us even briefly at home, seeing our
station, and going out to dinner. I never cease to be amazed at the endless
amount of energy you have. A1 and I discussed this afterward. It took us a
day to wake up after the merry chase you led us following our trip to Schoharie.
I just wish that Bunny and I could be at the Philadelphia meeting to do a little
more of the same. But, of course. Bunny is working, and I have to attend the
Affiliates Meeting the three days preceding the NAEB Meeting, which would mean
that I would be out of the office all that week. I will, however, try to get
down to Philadelphia for at least one of the days. I wish you great success
with the Philadelphia meeting.
If Dan Button does not send you a copy 6£ the speech for the journal, please
let me know and I will remind him that he offered to do it.
Our NYSERTA Meeting was greatly enhanced by having Vem Bronson and Bill Harley.
I am sure that those people who are not members of the NAEB or do not know very
much about NAEB are certainly much more aware of the value of the national or¬
ganization when they see in person the fine caliber of leadership it has.
I hope we can get together again soon.
Sincerely,
Donald E. Schein
